PERSONA:
meet ryan thompson, a 42-year-old white non-hispanic male residing in the metropolitan area of columbus, ohio, within the east north central division of the midwest. ryan holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from ohio state university and has some postgraduate education in finance. he was born in the united states, specifically in columbus, where he has lived for most of his life, except for a brief period during his early twenties when he worked in chicago for a few years. 

ryan is a successful financial analyst in a mid-sized investment firm, earning a salary of around $125,000 per year. his wife, emily, is a part-time elementary school teacher, contributing an additional $40,000 to their annual household income of approximately $165,000. they have two children, ages 8 and 10, who attend a local public school.

ryan and his family live in a comfortable, two-story house in the suburbs of columbus, with an approximate value of $280,000. they have a mortgage with a monthly payment of around $1,800. ryan is a registered voter and exercises his right to vote regularly, supporting republican candidates, aligning with his conservative views.

as a born-again christian, ryan attends church a few times a year, mostly during holidays and special occasions. his conservative ideology is shaped by his religious beliefs, as well as his concern about the economy, taxes, and national security. he strongly believes in limited government intervention in the economy and individual freedom.

ryan is an avid user of the internet, staying almost constantly connected to stay updated on news and global events. despite his busy schedule, he tries to stay informed about local and national politics. he and his family enjoy outdoor activities, such as hiking and camping, which has influenced his support for conservative environmental policies that promote responsible use of natural resources.

in his free time, ryan enjoys watching sports, particularly ohio state football games, and reading articles on finance and economics. his economic concerns are primarily centered around maintaining a strong economy, reducing national debt, and ensuring the financial security of his family.
